courses.name: Elementary Japanese I
courses.description: For beginners with no prior knowledge of Japanese.  Three hours of lecture instruction and three hours of practice/drill per week in small groups.

courses.name: Elementary Japanese II
courses.description: Three hours of lecture instruction and three hours of practice/drill per week in small groups.
courses.prerequisites: C- or better in JAPNSE 1100, or equivalent

courses.name: Topics in Japanese-General
courses.description: Organized study of selected topics. Subjects and credits may vary from semester to semester.

courses.name: Topics in Japanese - Humanities
courses.description: Organized study of selected topics. Subjects and credits may vary from semester to semester. No knowledge of Japanese required. No language credit.

courses.name: Japanese Conversation and Composition
courses.prerequisites: C- or better in JAPNSE 1200, or equivalent

courses.name: Japanese Civilization I
courses.description: Survey of Japanese culture and arts before 1868. May be taken independently of JAPNSE 2320. No knowledge of Japanese required. No foreign language credit.

courses.name: Japanese Civilization II
courses.description: Survey of Japanese culture and arts after 1868. May be taken independently of JAPNSE 2310. No knowledge of Japanese required. No foreign language credit.

courses.name: The World of Japanese Business
courses.description: Designed to assist the student to achieve successful business contacts with Japanese counterparts by understanding the characteristics of Japanese business in cultural, economical, and practical contexts and by learning useful Japanese terms and expressions in business.

courses.name: Problems in Japanese
courses.description: Supervised study in Japanese language and/or culture.

courses.name: Intermediate Japanese Composition and Conversation
courses.description: Further develops oral command of Japanese as well as listening comprehension and further essay writing skills.

courses.name: Classical Japanese Literature (in translation)
courses.description: This course studies Classical Japanese Literature preceded by a brief historical survey of Japanese literature. Analyzes such works as "The Tale of Genji",  "Essays in Idleness", "The Pillow Book",  "Hojoki" and NO drama. Readings and lectures in English.

courses.name: Modern Japanese Literature (in Translation)
courses.description: Surveys Japanese literature from 1868 to present. Analyzes works by such authors as Soseki, Tanizaki, Kawabata, Mishima, Oe, Murakami, and others. Readings and lectures in English.

courses.name: Intermediate Readings in Japanese
courses.description: Develops reading and speaking skills and acquisition of more Kanji, vocabulary, and complex structures.
courses.prerequisites: C- or better in JAPNSE 3160, or equivalent, or instructor's consent

courses.name: Intermediate Japanese II
courses.description: Continues development of intermediate reading, listening, speaking, and writing skills achieved in JAPNSE 3370, with attention to vocabulary acquisition, expansion of knowledge of kanji, and understanding of complex grammatical structures.  Authentic readings in Japanese literature and exercises using authentic multi-media materials also help students gain greater familiarity with Japanese culture.  Encourages development of student autonomy in language learning with the introduction and use of appropriate reference materials.

courses.name: Traditional Japanese Theatre
courses.description: Study of the history, scripts, and performance techniques of Japanese theatre from 14th century through late 19th century. Examines major plays (in English translations) and the culture that created them. Looks at staging and performance techniques of traditional puppet theatre. Course included stage performances and performances on campus and/or in the community.

courses.name: Japan and its Cinema
courses.description: Survey and analysis of selected Japanese films from the 1940s to present. Films will be viewed and discussed in terms of history, techniques, artistry, and social impact. English subtitles. No foreign language credit.

courses.name: Topics in Japanese - Humanities
courses.description: Organized study of selected topics. Subjects and earnable credit may vary from semester to semester. Suitable for students who have taken JAPNSE 3370 or equivalent.

courses.name: Topics in Japanese - Humanities - Honors
courses.description: Organized study of selected topics. Subjects and earnable credit may vary from semester to semester. Suitable for students who have taken JAPNSE 3370 or equivalent.
courses.prerequisites: instructor's consent, sophomore standing; Honors eligibility required

courses.name: Advanced Japanese I
courses.description: Continues development of reading, listening, speaking, writing skills, with attention to vocabulary acquisition, expansion of knowledge of kanji, and understanding of complex grammatical structures.  Authentic readings in Japanese literature, exercises using authentic multi-media materials.  Encourages development of student autonomy in language learning with introduction and use of appropriate reference materials.
courses.prerequisites: JAPNSE 3380 or equivalent, or instructor's consent

courses.name: Advanced Japanese II
courses.description: This course continues the development of reading, listening, speaking, and writing skills, with attention to vocabulary acquisition, expansion of knowledge of kanji, and understanding of complex grammatical structures.  Authentic readings in Japanese literature and exercises using authentic multimedia materials also help students gain greater familiarity with Japanese culture. The course encourages the development of student autonomy in language learning with the introduction and use of appropriate reference materials.
